title: Are AI-powered robot killers inevitable? - Quora

response.answer_text: Original Question: “Are AI-powered robot killers inevitable?” <Begin dodgy impression of professor Farnsworth from Futurama> Sadly, no. We must roll up our sleaves and work long hours to make it happen… <End dodgy impression of professor Farnsworth from Futurama> Oh, wait… You were going in the other direction on this weren’t you..? Throughout history people atracted to power have always had certain ambitions. Two of them are: “Gain more devoted followers” (Both numerically and in terms of devotion) and “destroy all opposition”. The creation of AI controlled robots provides an opportunity for as many followers as any would-be despot could hope for. It also provides the opportunity for as many potential rescuers , that are willing to enter hazardous environments as we could hope for. You see, even AI controlled robots are just tools, shells waiting to be motivated by a programmer. Help or hinder, save or condemn, fix or destroy, these are all motivations that are decided by the owner / creator. Otherwise they wouldn’t have any use and wouldn’t be built in the first place. Don’t fear the tool, fear motives of the owner. So… TLDR version: Yes. They are inevitable (and may already be deployed). But there were always plenty of human beings willing to do anything an AI controlled robot would do, anyway.
